dmca.title: [ABUSE] Case ID 67918999 - Notice of Claimed Infringement
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Tuesday, June 14, 2005 12:22 AM
To: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: Fwd: [ABUSE] Case ID 67918999 - Notice of Claimed Infringement



Begin forwarded message:

> From: Business Software Alliance <copyright@bsa.org>
> Date: June 13, 2005 14:22:35 CDT
> To: abuse@theplanet.com
> Subject: [ABUSE] Case ID 67918999 - Notice of Claimed Infringement
> Received: from [172.16.214.181] (helo=mx02.filter.theplanet.com) by 
> mail.theplanet.com with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim
> 4.50) id 1DhuWC-000310-Rb for abuseadm@theplanet.com; Mon, 13 Jun
> 2005 14:22:44 -0500
> Received: from spooling.theplanet.com ([69.56.141.4]
> helo=lili.theplanet.com) by mx02.filter.theplanet.com (envelope- from 
> abuse-bounces@lists.theplanet.com) with smtp (Exim) id 
> 1DhuW9-000Ikf-JC for abuseadm@theplanet.com; Mon, 13 Jun 2005
> 14:22:44 -0500
> Received: (qmail 11658 invoked from network); 13 Jun 2005 19:22:41 
> -0000
> Received: from unknown (HELO ?216.185.111.52?) (172.16.214.110) by 
> lili.theplanet.com with SMTP; 13 Jun 2005 19:22:41 -0000
> Received: from [172.16.214.180] (helo=mx01.filter.theplanet.com) by 
> mail.theplanet.com with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim
> 4.50) id 1DhuW7-00030f-Bx for abuse@theplanet.com; Mon, 13 Jun 2005
> 14:22:39 -0500
> Received: from mail.bsa.org ([209.70.21.12]) by 
> mx01.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from copyright@bsa.org) with esmtp 
> (Exim) id 1DhuW5-000IDR-NI for abuse@theplanet.com; Mon, 13 Jun 2005 
> 14:22:39 -0500
> Received: from dc-mail.bsa.org ([192.168.1.28]) by mail.bsa.org with 
> Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.211); Mon, 13 Jun 2005 15:22:31 -0400
> Received: from ASCHUBERT1 ([192.168.1.115]) by dc-mail.bsa.org with 
> Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.211); Mon, 13 Jun 2005 15:22:36 -0400
> Mime-Version: 1.0
> Content-Type: multipart/mixed; Boundary="--PTCP_0000000101033c07d5"
> Message-Id: <0000000201033d07d5@[192.168.1.115]>
> X-Originalarrivaltime: 13 Jun 2005 19:22:36.0557 (UTC) FILETIME= 
> [419DA3D0:01C5704D]
> Received-Spf: none (mx01.filter.theplanet.com: 209.70.21.12 is neither 
> permitted nor denied by domain of bsa.org) client- ip=209.70.21.12; 
> envelope-from=copyright@bsa.org; helo=mail.bsa.org;
> X-Spam-Level: ---------------------------------------------------
> X-Spam-Level: ---------------------------------------------------
> X-Spam-Score: -94.9
> X-Spam-Score: -95.6
> X-Beenthere: abuse@lists.theplanet.com
> X-Mailman-Version: 2.1.5
> Precedence: list
> List-Id: abuse.lists.theplanet.com
> List-Unsubscribe: <http://lists.theplanet.com/mailman/listinfo/
> abuse>, <mailto:abuse-request@lists.theplanet.com?subject=unsubscribe>
> List-Post: <mailto:abuse@lists.theplanet.com>
> List-Help: <mailto:abuse-request@lists.theplanet.com?subject=help>
> List-Subscribe: <http://lists.theplanet.com/mailman/listinfo/
> abuse>, <mailto:abuse-request@lists.theplanet.com?subject=subscribe>
> Sender: abuse-bounces@lists.theplanet.com
> Errors-To: abuse-bounces@lists.theplanet.com
>
>
> Monday, June 13, 2005
>
> RE:  Unauthorized Distribution of the following copyrighted computer 
> program(s):
>
> Macromedia Coldfusion
> Macromedia Dreamweaver
> Macromedia Fireworks
> Macromedia Flash
> Macromedia Freehand
>
> Dear Sir/Madam:
>
> The Business Software Alliance (BSA) has determined that the website 
> listed below, which appears to be on servers under your control, is 
> offering unlicensed copies or is engaged in other unauthorized 
> activities relating to copyrighted computer programs published by the 
> BSA's member companies.
>
> Infringing material or activity found at the following location(s):  
> http://mmedia.hollosite.com/index2.html? 
> checkboxname=ON&agree=Continue+To+Downloads
>
> The above computer program(s) [SERIAL number] is/are being made 
> available for copying, through downloading, at the above location 
> without authorization from the copyright owner(s).
>
> Based upon BSA's representation of the copyright owners in anti- 
> piracy matters, we have a good faith belief that none of the materials 
> or activities listed above have been authorized by the rightholders, 
> their agents, or the law.  BSA represents that the information in this 
> notification is accurate and states, under penalty of perjury, that it 
> is authorized to act in this matter on behalf of the copyright owners 
> listed above.
>
> We are giving notice of these activities pursuant to Section 512 of  
> Title 17 of the U.S. Code (as enacted by the 'Online Copyright 
> Infringement Liability Limitation Act').  We expect that you will take 
> expeditious action to remove or disable access to the materials 
> described above, and thereby prevent the illegal reproduction and 
> distribution of pirated software via your company's network. As you 
> know, illegal on-line activities can result in 50 million people on 
> the Internet accessing and downloading a copyrighted product worldwide 
> without authorization - a highly damaging activity for the copyright 
> holder.
>
> We appreciate your cooperation in this matter. Please advise us 
> regarding what actions you take.
>
> Please include the following CaseID in any response you send: Case ID 
> 67918999
>
> Yours sincerely,
>
>
> John R. Wolfe
> Manager of Investigations
> Business Software Alliance
> 1150 18th St NW Suite 700
> Washington, DC 20036
> URL: http://www.bsa.org
> E-mail: copyright@bsa.org
